intro: Pleurospermum cicutarium, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features finely divided, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Due to its aromatic properties, it has been used historically in traditional medicine.
